akn:subsection.akn:heading: Application to a Sentence by a Magistrate Judge.—

akn:content.akn:p: (h) An appeal of an otherwise final sentence imposed by a United States magistrate judge may be taken to a judge of the district court, and this section shall apply (except for the requirement of approval by the Attorney General or the Solicitor General in the case of a Government appeal) as though the appeal were to a court of appeals from a sentence imposed by a district court.

akn:subsection.akn:heading: Guideline Not Expressed as a Range.—

akn:content.akn:p: (i) For the purpose of this section, the term “guideline range” includes a guideline range having the same upper and lower limits.
